div1.p: IN THE UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT, IN AND FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
UNITED STATES OF AMERICA, Plaintiff, vs. Barney Slomen, Defendant. No. Affidavit of Petitioner.
STATE OF WASHINGTON COUNTY OF KING ss

BARNEY SLOMEN, being first duly sworn, on oath deposes and says: That he is the above name petitioner; that he is without the means to pay the fees or necessary costs of court in this action; that your petitioner is a native born citizen of the United States and is entitled to all the rights accrued to him under the Forma Pauperie Act, accrued June 25, 1910, 36th Statute, 86.
WHEREFORE, your petitioner prays for an Order of court that he may appear in this action in Forma Pauperis.
That the necessary fees and costs of court be paid by the Government.
That the court make any further Order that it may deem necessary to afford your petitioner full and adequate relief.
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 1 day of July, 1916. Adam Beele Notary Public in and for the State of Washington, residing at
